mistream LOCAL mistream

NAME

mjo_istream_read — read an UTF-8 character from an input stream

SYNOPSIS

#include <mistream.h>

int
mjo_istream_read(enum mjo_status *const o_status, struct mjo_utf8 *const o_peek, mjo_istream_t const io_stream);

DESCRIPTION

Read an UTF-8 character from an input stream.

Following is a description of the arguments.

o_status
pointer to an ‘enum mjo_status’ that shall be set to one of the following four (4) indicators: (1) mjo_status_ok, (2) mjo_status_invalid, (3) mjo_status_eof, or (4) mjo_status_truncated
o_peek
pointer to a ‘struct mjo_utf8’ that shall be set to the UTF-8 character read
io_stream
pointer to a ‘mjo_istream_t’ that shall be read from

If o_status is nil, it shall not be set.

If o_peek or io_stream is nil, it shall be denoted as an invalid argument.

RETURN VALUES

If any of the arguments are invalid, the return code shall be MJO_FAIL and errno shall be set to EINVAL and *o_status shall be set to mjo_status_invalid.

Upon success, the return code shall be MJO_OK. However, the caller must check *o_status for the condition of o_peek.

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
